proof_points: Loyalty program savings on regular purchases

proof_points: Efficient store layout for faster shopping

quality_objections.customer_concern: I'll waste money on food that spoils
quality_objections.authentic_response: We've heard that concern and it's exactly why we implemented [FRESHNESS GUARANTEE/POLICY]. Our produce arrives [DELIVERY FREQUENCY] and our team removes anything that doesn't meet standards throughout the day. If anything doesn't last as long as you expect, bring your receipt and we'll replace it or refund you - no questions asked.

habit_objections.authentic_response: We respect loyalty - it means [CURRENT STORE] has served you well. We're not asking you to switch everything at once. There's no commitment - just see if we might serve your family better.

proof_points: Specific department strength to try first

time_objections.objection: I don't have time for grocery shopping
time_objections.customer_concern: Grocery shopping takes too much time from my busy life

You can shop your list in 10 minutes from your phone, and either pick up without leaving your car or have it delivered. For in-store shopping, our app shows you exactly where items are located so you can get in and out in [TIME FRAME].

authority.hook:
Hot take: The future of supermarkets isn't about competing with Amazon.

It's about becoming what Amazon can never be. 🧵
authority.body:
After [NUMBER] years running [STORE_NAME], here's what I know:

1/ Community beats convenience (eventually)

Sure, 2-hour delivery is great. But we know [CUSTOMER_NAME] needs low-sodium options for her dad. We set them aside every week. Amazon can't do that.

2/ Fresh is our superpower

Our produce arrives from [LOCAL_FARM] at [TIME]am. It's on shelves by [TIME]. Try getting that freshness delivered. 🥬

3/ Experience matters

Our butcher taught [NUMBER] customers how to cook [CUT_OF_MEAT] this week. Our baker does custom orders for dietary restrictions. That's not transactional - it's relational.

4/ Local = loyal

We stock [NUMBER] products from [CITY] makers. When you shop with us, $[AMOUNT] of every $100 stays local. That resonates.

5/ Data + humanity = magic

Yes, we use AI for inventory. But our staff uses that data to have BETTER human interactions, not replace them.

The supermarkets that survive won't out-Amazon Amazon.

They'll out-HUMAN Amazon.

We're not in the grocery business. We're in the community nourishment business. 💚

Retail folks: Agree? Disagree? What's working in your market?

pricing_psychology.charm_pricing: Use .99 and .97 endings on sale items to signal deals ($3.99 vs $4.00)
pricing_psychology.anchor_pricing: Show regular price crossed out next to sale price to emphasize savings
pricing_psychology.unit_pricing: Display cost per ounce/pound to help customers compare and feel informed
pricing_psychology.bundle_pricing: Create meal bundles (protein + sides + dessert) at slight discount vs. individual items
pricing_psychology.threshold_pricing: Promote 'under $5 meals' or '$20 feeds a family of 4' to create budget frameworks
pricing_psychology.loyalty_pricing: Show member price vs. non-member price to drive app downloads and card signups
pricing_psychology.loss_leader: Heavily discount milk, eggs, bread to drive traffic, profit on complementary items
pricing_psychology.decoy_pricing: Offer three sizes where medium looks like best value to drive upsells from small
